You have probably customized your computer. A custom foldering schema to manage your files. A different browser to access the Internet the way you want. An ad blocker or three to protect your data. Adapting the computer to your needs transforms it from a useful tool to your effective tool.

We can and should take similar steps when preparing a computer to become a tool for Python tool creation and usage. This guide focuses on four key areas.

  • Shell and Terminal
    • Understanding the terminal
    • Creating a profile
    • Customizing a prompt
  • Virtual Environments
    • Managing Python versions
    • Managing Python modules
  • Code Editing
    • Launching Visual Studio Code from the terminal
    • Linting Python in VS Code
    • Extending VS Code functions
  • Version Control
    • Setting up git
    • Configuring git with Github

This particular approach was developed with a few philosophies.

Keyboard First

The keyboard is the most common, and sometimes only, computer interface. In order to work in environments ranging from your personal computer to a VM in a data center, being familiar with keyboard navigation is key.

Containment

Any changes to the computer should be easily reversible.

Mac/Linux First
